conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the suitcase.
The suitcase can be pushed or pulled on the ground.
The total mass of the suitcase is 15 kg.
The gravitational acceleration is g = 10 m/s².
The minimum value of the pull is 90 N.
The angle between the pull and the horizontal direction is θ.
The resistance of the suitcase to the ground is proportional to the supporting force of the ground, the ratio is μ.
The force of gravity is 10 m/s².
Identify all forces acting on the suitcase: F (pull force at angle θ), N (normal force), G (gravitational force), f (friction force).

premise: The mass of the suitcase is 15 kg and gravitational acceleration is 10 m/s².
conclusion: The weight of the suitcase is G = 15 kg × 10 m/s² = 150 N.

premise: The suitcase moves with uniform motion, net force must be zero.
conclusion: Vertical forces equation: N + F·sin(θ) - 150 = 0, Horizontal forces equation: F·cos(θ) = f.

premise: Friction is proportional to the normal force: f = μN.
conclusion: Substitute into horizontal forces equation: F·cos(θ) = μ(150 - F·sin(θ)).

premise: For minimum pull force, tan(θ) = μ.
